results.headline: From War Casualty to Zombie, and Happy to Be Undead
results.summary_short: In “The Revenant” a good-hearted soldier dies, becomes a zombie, and realizes he needs infusions of human blood to remain undead.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Revenant

results.headline: Identities and Lives Rooted in Two Worlds
results.summary_short: The documentary “Somewhere Between” examines the lives of four teenage girls adopted from China and the policies that allowed that personal and cultural journey.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Somewhere Between

results.headline: Stand-Up Comedian’s Surrealistic Nightmares
results.summary_short: In “Sleepwalk With Me,” a movie that the comic performer and writer Mike Birbiglia adapted from his one-man show, a slightly schlubby comedian takes his act on the road.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sleepwalk with Me

results.headline: Around the World in 99 Minutes and Zero Words
results.summary_short: Filmed in 25 countries and using striking images but no narration or dialogue, “Samsara” examines the state of the modern world.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Samsara

results.headline: By the Sea, by the Sea, Rivalries and Conflicts
results.summary_short: In “Little White Lies” a group of friends journey to Cap Ferrat for their annual communal vacation despite a life-threatening accident that lands one of them in intensive care.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Little White Lies

results.headline: From the Slums to the Soccer Field, 2 Boys Grasp at Hope
results.summary_short: In “Hermano” soccer represents a ticket out of the slums for two talented Venezuelan boys.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hermano

results.headline: Lessons in Life, Love and Tennis
results.summary_short: In “General Education” a teenager has landed a college tennis scholarship, but first he needs to graduate from high school after flunking a course, without Mom and Dad finding out.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of General Education

results.headline: Casting Blame for Jobs That Vanish
results.summary_short: “Death by China,” a documentary by Peter Navarro, says the admission of China to the World Trade Organization has been catastrophic for the American economy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Death By China

results.headline: Gentle Giant Seeks the Strength to Body Check His Mother
results.summary_short: In “Teddy Bear,” a low-key Danish drama, the bodybuilder Kim Kold portrays a 38-year-old man-child trying hard to grow up.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Teddy Bear

results.headline: For This Man-Child, the Thrill of the Chase Has Yet to Grow Old
results.summary_short: “Hit & Run” stars Dax Shepard as a goofball in the witness protection program who is soon back in trouble.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hit And Run

results.headline: Fog and Faces: Day and Night in the Punjab
results.summary_short: The writer and director Gurvinder Singh’s film “Alms for a Blind Horse” shows situations during a day and a night in the Punjab, in northwestern India.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Alms for a Blind Horse

results.headline: Seeing Ghosts Wherever He Looks
results.summary_short: Norman, the focus of this beautiful-looking 3-D stop-motion animation, is an 11-year-old who cannot only see dead people, but is happy to hang out with them.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of ParaNorman

results.headline: Real-Life Creepiness: Just Following Orders
results.summary_short: In Craig Zobel’s “Compliance” a fast-food manager confines and searches an employee at the direction of a telephone caller identifying himself as a police officer.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Compliance

results.headline: An Addled Mother and Her Prodigy Son Need Drugs, and Fast
results.summary_short: In “Why Stop Now?” the shenanigans begin when a cocaine addict, played by Melissa Leo, is badgered by her son, portrayed by Jesse Eisenberg, to enter rehab.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Why Stop Now?

results.headline: Adopting a Beast as One of Their Own
results.summary_short: “True Wolf,” a documentary by Rob Whitehair, documents the efforts of Bruce Weide and Pat Tucker as caretakers of a female wolf named Koani.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of True Wolf

results.headline: Amid Unrest, Hope and Glimmers of Romance
results.summary_short: Avi Nesher’s “Matchmaker” is a coming-of-age tale in which a teenager living in Haifa, Israel, in 1968 spends a summer doing background checks for a scarred matchmaker.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Matchmaker

results.headline: Ghosts and Memories Haunting a House
results.summary_short: “The Awakening,” directed by Nick Murphy and starring Rebecca Hall and Dominic West, is a ghost story set in an England paralyzed with grief after the traumas of World War I.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Awakening

results.headline: A Woman Who Knows the Music Industry, and a Few Who Don’t (Yet)
results.summary_short: Jordin Sparks has the title role in “Sparkle,” a Cinderella tale out of Motown that features the last screen performance by Whitney Houston.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sparkle

results.headline: Master of a Shrinking Universe
results.summary_short: “Cosmopolis,” directed by David Cronenberg and based on a novel by Don DeLillo, follows a young man with plenty of money.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Cosmopolis

results.headline: Strings Coming Loose for a Violinist in Tehran
results.summary_short: In “Chicken With Plums,” from the artist behind “Persepolis,” a tormented violinist takes to his bed to await the end of his life.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Chicken with Plums
